intro: Adenocalymma alboviolaceum, commonly known as the white-violet adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers with white markings, which are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
